content: stones on the beach hat by jennifer knight list of abbreviations approx-approximately co-cast on k-knit p-purl cont-continue dpn s -double point needle s k2tog-knit two together m1- make one pm-place marker repeat-repeat round s -round s sl m-slip marker ssk- slip slip k2 slipped sts together st s -stitch es yo-yarn over sk2p-slip one k2tog psso psso- pass slipped stitch over this slouchy hat is a perfect reminder of summer shores and stones on the beach it s a lightweight early season hat that may end up being a favorite to wear because it s so comfy skill level advanced beginner to intermediate sizes adult small-medium fits approx 18-22 head finished measurements version 1 approx 9 version 2 approx 11 from co to top 9 no stretching wide gauge blocked 28sts and 38rows =4 yarn any 4ply fingering weight- less than 100g if you are doing version 1 you may need just 50g version 1 bare naked wool- stone soup fingering version 2 yarn indulgences-indulgent style fingering needles 3mm 16 circular 3mm dpns other materials 1 stitch marker tapestry needle instructions with 3mm circular needles cast on 144 sts loosely join in a round work k1 p1 ribbing for 12 rounds next round increase 6 sts evenly as follows * rib 24 m1 repeat from * to end of round 150sts notes you may find it convenient to place a marker to show the beginning of your rounds please slip the marker as you come to it start pattern stitch 1 as follows round 1 * yo k3 sk2p k3 yo k1 repeat from * to end of round round 2 knit around round 3 * k1 yo k2 sk2p k2 yo k1 p1 repeat from * to end of round round 4 *k9 p1 repeat from * to end of round round 5 * k2 yo k1 sk2p k1 yo k2 p1 repeat from * to end of round round 6 as round 4 round 7 *k3 yo sk2p yo k3 p1 repeat from * to end of round round 8 knit these 8 rounds form the first pattern stitch repeat these 8 rounds 4 more times pattern stitch 2 round 1 *k3 yo sk2p yo k3 p1 repeat from * to end of round round 2 *k9 p1 repeat from * to end of round repeat these last 2 rounds until piece measures 7 for version 1 or 9 for version 2 or desired length please be aware that yarn requirements will change for different lengths crown shaping for both versions
